Prop.Name: Title
Prop.Description: Optional title for the grid.

Prop.Name: AddToParentGxUIControl
Prop.Description: True to add the control to its parent GxUI control (if there's one). Defaults to true.

Prop.Name: UseThemeClasses
Prop.Description: True to use the Theme classes asigned to the grid and columns, false to ignore them.

Prop.Name: EnableColumnLocking
Prop.Description: True to allow column locking ala Ms Excel's "Freeze Panes" option.

Prop.Name: SelectionModel
Prop.Description: The selection model to use with the grid: RowSelectionModel (rows are selected by clicking on the row) or CheckBoxSelectionModel (a check box appears in the first column of the grid). If the grid has at least one editable column, the selection model is ignored as a cell by cell model is used.

Prop.Name: DragDropGroup
Prop.Description: A named drag drop group to which this object belongs. If a group is specified, then this object will only interact with other drag drop objects in the same group. This is useful when using drag and drop between a {@link gxui.Treeview tree} and a grid.

Prop.Name: DragDropText
Prop.Description: Configures the text in the drag proxy that is shown during the drag/drop operation.

Prop.Name: PrimaryButtonOnly
Prop.Description: Set to false to allow drag and drop to start with any mouse click that is propogated by the browser.

Prop.Name: Grouping
Prop.Description: True to allow to display the grid rows aggregated into groups. The group will show the title for the group name and then the appropriate records for the group underneath. The groups can also be expanded and collapsed.

Prop.Name: ShowGroupingSummary
Prop.Description: True to add an aggregate summary row at the bottom of each group. * The summary value needs to be calculated for each column in the grid. This is controlled by the {@link gxui.GridExtensionColumn#SummaryType} option specified on the column.

Prop.Name: GroupField
Prop.Description: The name of the attribute or variable to group on (case sensitive). When a SDT is bound to the grid, use the name of the SDT member. Data should be sorted by this field when paging is enabled.

Prop.Name: HideGroupedField
Prop.Description: True to hide the grouping field.

Prop.Name: GroupTemplate
Prop.Description: The template used to render the group header.

Prop.Name: ForceFit
Prop.Description: True to auto expand/contract the size of the columns to fit the grid width and prevent horizontal scrolling.

Prop.Name: MinColumnWidth
Prop.Description: The minimum width a column can be resized to.

Prop.Name: EnableColumnHide
Prop.Description: True to enable hiding of columns with the header context menu.

Prop.Name: EnableColumnMove
Prop.Description: True to enable drag and drop reorder of columns.

Prop.Name: RemoteSort
Prop.Description: Indicates if sort operations will be performed locally (on the current page) or remotely over the whole data set. * To accomplish this, orders must be programmed on the webpanel accordingly. For example, in a grid with CustomerName and CustomerAddress fields, * the order clauses should be: * * CustomerName when (Grid1.SortField = 'CustomerName' and Grid1.SortOrder = 'ASC') or Grid1.SortField = '' * (CustomerName) when Grid1.SortField = 'CustomerName' and Grid1.SortOrder = 'DESC' * CustomerAddress when Grid1.SortField = 'CustomerAddress' and Grid1.SortOrder = 'ASC' * (CustomerAddress) when Grid1.SortField = 'CustomerAddress' and Grid1.SortOrder = 'DESC' * * Bear in mind that sorting must be enabled by setting the {@link gxui.GridExtensionColumn#Sortable Sortable} = True in the column.

Prop.Name: SortField
Prop.Description: The field used to sort the grid.

Prop.Name: SortOrder
Prop.Description: The sort order of the grid (ASC|DESC). Defaults to ASC.

Prop.Name: FirstText
Prop.Description: Text of the "First page" button.

Prop.Name: LastText
Prop.Description: Text of the "Last page" button.

Prop.Name: NextText
Prop.Description: Text of the "Next page" button.

Prop.Name: PreviousText
Prop.Description: Text of the "Previous page" button.

Prop.Name: RefreshText
Prop.Description: Text of the "Refresh" button.

Prop.Name: StatusText
Prop.Description: Text shown at the right side of the paging bar. Useful to show status messages or a text indicating the current page and the page count.

Prop.Name: Stateful
Prop.Description: A flag which causes the Component to attempt to restore the state of internal properties from a saved state on startup.

Prop.Name: StateId
Prop.Description: The unique id for this component to use for state management purposes.

Prop.Name: SelectedRow
Prop.Description: The index of the selected row. Changing this property changes the selected row.
